Agreed
Honestly shocked this doesn't have more votes, It just makes so much sense. Although I'll add to this, Slimes should also be immune to the effects of the honey block.
Not only should they not take fall damage. They should bounce.

Slimes should not take fall damage. They should also be immune to suffocating in blocks and immune to drowning. They should bounce when they fall and jump further when they fall from a higher height. And if the player falls on a slime, the slime will not hurt them and they will bounce off of the slime as if it is a slime block.

It should make its own sound, but slightly different depending on whether the mob it's imitating it hostile or not. This would make it possible to tell, but not easy. It could imitate anything if it spawns in the end (as there is not much to copy there) and could potentially even mimic the player, mirroring their actions (including placing and breaking blocks) and would act like an enderman if hit.

So this is kind of an old post, but it's what came up when i searched and I agree. Bee's take a lot of dmg, much like rabits. Due to their small hit boxes they tend to take suffocation dmg very easily. Flying into a block that's not transparent like glass can easily lead them to taking a point of dmg or two. Merely exiting their hive if it's blocked on any side by a solid block can often have them take a tick or two of dmg before they move off.

Some form of self preservation would be great. Either they heal while in the hive, possibly a small chance to self breed while in a hive with full honey levels or something. The bad AI, low hp and many sources of dmg that can kill a Bee (never mind the fact they die if they sting something) can easily wipe out your entire colony with ease.

Most automated farms are not too hurt by this, but if you don't want to enclose everything in glass and trap your bee's they are very fragile. It ruins the ability to use them for more aesthetic builds, like having free roaming bee's over your fields.

I recently started bee keeping and this became an immediate issue I've noticed. Frequently when my bees exit the hive, they are still partially inside the hive block and start to receive block suffocation damage. I try to give them flowers to heal them but it doesn't seem to work and the bees slowly die off. I have to continue to breed them in order for the population to stay at peak volume.

If they slowly regenerated health, or regenerated health in the hive, that would be awesome. Or even if they could just refresh their health entirely in the hive! If I'm not mistaken players used to (or still do) get their health bar replenished when sleeping in a bed. I don't see why it's so different to just give hive-exiting bees full health.

I don't even think honey levels should be removed. I think they should just leave the hive with full hp every time.
Maybe it can be 1-4 kittens per litter?
That’s a lot of cats. If cat breeding were enhanced like that, every player would easily repel creepers from their base with minimal effort.

I'd like to see a Nether biome made entirely out of brain tissue, like a living infestation. The ground would make wet squishing sounds when you walk on it, and there would be a danger of being electrocuted by synapses firing in the ground. I think these mobs would be better suited to a biome such as this.

To Jack Smith: YES! I honestly think this would be adorable! Instead of calling them dog beds, just call them pet beds! Beds for all pets! Cats, dogs, tegus, and even parrots could use them! Thank you for this mind-boggling revelation!
I LOVE TEGUS AND PRETTY MUCH ANY REPTILE OR AMPHIBIAN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

A master forager is made by crafting a Forager table and placing it next to a fisherman, a shepherd, or farmer. Master villagers sell the master items of the professions they came from(plus some extra because some professions need stuff)
Foragers sell golden carrots or glistening melons(farmer), buy puffer fish or boats(fisherman), and sell paintings(shepherd).

Enchanters can be made from master clerics and cartographers as well as librarians. Enchanters would sell name tags, enchanted bottles, buy nether wart, and sell a banner pattern and two enchanted books.

Master Smiths sell either a full set diamond armor with a random 20-30 level enchantment, a full set of random level 20-30 enchanted tools(including swords). 
A master Crafter is made when you have a master Mason, Leatherworker, butcher, or fletcher, and you give them a crafting table. They sell blocks of quartz or pillars of quartz, a random level 20-30 enchant bow or crossbow, a random conversion from regular arrows to tipped ones, a saddle or leather horse armor, and they buy scutes, tripwires, and quartz.

I thought of another potential Master Profession: the Bee Keeper.

Giving Max level Farmers a Bee Hive (the craftable one) would allow it to become a Bee Keeper.

The reason it would be for Farmers is because Bees help crops grow when they fly over them with pollen, so I think it makes sense for a Farmer to take advantage of that.

People love Minecraft not because it's realistic, it's because people can create great things, build anything without worrying about the laws and restrictions of physics, and not worry about death of old age. In short, what makes the unrealism appealing is the fact that you can do anything that you cannot otherwise do in the real world, which is way more realistic than Minecraft would ever be. If you want Minecraft to be more "realistic",  go to the real world and build yourself a farm with pigs that actually die of old age.
No. No no no.

On hard difficulty, Spiders already have a percentage chance of spawning with certain status effects (speed, strength, invisibility, regeneration). Maybe instead of increasing the damage, move these percentages to normal and increase them on hard.

Why not differ races-society of piglins?

Like Red, blue, black and so on, each one with different behaviour and technological level, from nomadic hunters to feudal, some races could have his own structures like villagers and pillagers

Some society could have his own professions and working stations, that differ from villagers

Some could even have control over nether portals with fortress that generate both in nether and the overworld (that races must have overworld immunity or have some artifacts that protect them from become zombies)

It could be a sort of inerdimensional invasion (the great tusks empire)

I like this idea. I also advocate for piglins spawning exclusively in crimson forests because existing gold farms in nether wastes would break or be less efficient when piglins begin spawning as well as the zombie pigman (soon to be zombified piglins).

200 health seems like a bit much, maybe bring it down to 20 (Skeleton/Zombie/Player levels) and add flame damage on contact instead. Also the fire breath seems to be a bit much for a normal mob.

Now, if we had a Nether Monument in the lava, then your pseudo-dragon could very well be the boss of it, and drop the lava equivalent of sponge.

My spin on it: I like the wither angel idea, but stick to a netherite sword which deals the wither effect, don't summon ghasts as they're clearly living creatures and have nothing to do with the wither curse, and instead of an elytra upgrade, the boss should drop a nether star fragment - one quarter of a full star. Or perhaps they should drop skulls and wither roses instead.

By the way if you are asking me why does the wither angel can summon ghasts because they are kind of a commander of the nether army and by the way the idea of dropping the withered wing can be changed with some other item but it has to be new

Interesting idea.

 

But does anyone have a suggestion for those 6 other mobs?

Hmm. Red Tinted Ghasts that actively pursue the player for Wrath. Vengeful Ghasts?

Sloth could be a mushroom creature that lurks among the darker areas and has a 3 block detection radius. Could release spore clouds to attack and be bottled up as a replacement for limited Dragon's Breath in making lingering potions. Slothful beings linger around? Eh?
I really enjoy this concept, hopefully they'll end up doing something with this concept.

Maybe:

  • a miniboss "Fat Piglin" to represent Gluttony, spawns rarely in piglin tribes. It can eat piglins near it to regain health and boost it's other stats (I've always seen piglins as some variant of orc)
  • Justins idea of a red ghast to represent Wrath (their fireballs generate lava flow block [not source blocks], or something)
  • some kind of lava mermaid for Lust, similar to a Siren. Their breath attacks cause confusion, and they sit around in the lava or the shores waiting for the player. causes confusion and/or nausea, depending on the attack.
  • an impish-looking small mob that tries to take the spoils of your mining sessions, representing Envy. Incredibly physically weak, but really fast. Doesn't really attack you unless there's a lot of them and you have a lot of loot
  • a passive variant of Magma Cube that stays in-place to represent Sloth. Maybe touching it gives slowness and mining fatigue?
  • a miniboss variant of the wither skeleton that rules over nether fortresses to represent Pride. Not sure what to actually do for this one to make it special, besides give it a crown and cape.

Why not differ races-society of piglins?

Like Red, blue, black and so on, each one with different behaviour and technological level, some races could have his own structures like villagers and pillagers

I think it’s a great idea because then the bees will still live,

also make the bees smaller as well.

What if throwing them a potion of Regeneration, or some sort of new splash potion (maybe even one brewed from honey) could save them? Or using a bottle of honey on a bee could de-anger and restore them? It's just a really unpleasant way to lose a beloved companion through a single misclick, since you can't even let yourself die to avoid hurting them.

There would be both aesthetic and mechanical benefits to this change:

  • Gameplay: Soul Sand Valleys would become even more dangerous, but more profitable to exploit. Those who seek to summon the Wither have a new, risky place to farm their skulls, and those who don't have a new threat to navigate in addition to the swarming arrows and ghasts, adding a new aspect to the pace of combat.
  • Thematic: The Wither's effigy is built using soul sand, so having its lesser form appear in the most soul sand-dense area in the game would be a nice touch. In addition, allowing such an intimidating monster to spawn in the open would reinforce the biome's menacing atmosphere, making it more intense to explore.

this!! Wither skeletons would improve the SSV so much, and they match the atmosphere of the biome perfectly. They fit a lot better than the endermen that spawn here. I think endermen should be replaced with the wither skeletons in this biome. More than enough endermen spawn in the warped forest anyway
Yeah! I think it would be very possible to implement. I've always wanted to obtain infested blocks in survival, and using silk touch would be a very logical way to grant access to it.
I think this would generally make sense, and now that we have bee nests, we can see that it's plainly doable!

I suggest adding variant of salamanders spawning in warped forests.

I don't like it when players are encouraged to kill peaceful mobs, especially not salamanders :( Please make it better if they are alive? Maybe they shed their skin naturally, over time, and drop nothing?
